page.title: 14Limestone
page.content: {The rock in our area is limestone and can be seen in rocky outcrops,old quarries and in the{dry stone walls that are everywhere. Rivers often run underground and there are{caves and potholes}nearby. Limestone is the main{building stone and is also quarried for the production of cement,lime,roadstone and chippings. Galena and fluorspar are often found in limestone and there are remains of{old lead mines}with sometimes dangerous shafts exposed. As limestone drains well, there are few natural ponds and many farms have concrete{dewponds}-some of these have been filled in recently which has cut down the number of breeding places for frogs and other amphibians.
